chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Nathan J. Resheske was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to 2 days presentence credit IF revoked.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Ignition Interlock shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling and/or treatment as recommended by Agent.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 9/16/22 by 6:00 p.m.

8:34 AM Defendant Nathan J. Resheske in court.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for Nathan J. Resheske.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant and reviews chgs and pens.  Defendant enters Guilty plea in Count 1.  BAC - .17.  Attorney Kunisch heard on sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Skarie heard.  Defendant makes statement.  Court finds plea was made f/v/i;  accepts plea and finds defendant Guilty in Count 1.  Counts 2 & 3 are DRI.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

Count 1

w/held sentence - 36 mos probation

COP
8 mos DCJ w/h&t comm on or before 9-16-22 - 2 days credit if revoked
30 mos DL revocation and ignition interlock
$1,200 fine + court costs
$26 blood draw fee
AODA
maintain absolute sobriety
no bars, taverns or liquor stores
any treatment/counseling per agent
provide DNA sample
